data.title: [AUTO][ci skip]: updating cocos2dx_files.json
Node run action crash randomly with RepeatForever of a Sequence
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: 3.9
- devices test on: Nexus 5
- developing environments
  - NDK version: Android ndk > 11

I have integrated Cocos in an Android app. I use a NDK Helper which create a sequence from a function like in sample [http://cocos2d-x.org/docs/programmers-guide/actions/](url)

``` java
// target created before and sel a function
CallFunc *caller = CallFunc::create(sel);
auto action = Sequence::create(caller, nullptr);
target->runAction(action);
```

When I send to many time this part above (1 called every 16 ms), my app crash with this dump 

```
********** Crash dump: **********
Build fingerprint: 'google/hammerhead/hammerhead:6.0.1/MOB30Y/3067468:user/release-keys'
pid: 10858, tid: 10965, name: Timer-0  >>> com.example.cocos:cocosProcess <<<
signal 11 (SIGSEGV), code 1 (SEGV_MAPERR), fault addr 0x3
Stack frame #00 pc 0056239c  /data/app/com.example.cocos-1/lib/arm/liblCocos2dcpp.so (_ZN7cocos2d9Scheduler28unscheduleAllWithMinPriorityEi+404): Routine cocos2d::Scheduler::unscheduleAllWithMinPriority(int) at /home/kevin/Projects/Sample/com/example/cocos/../cocos2d/cocos/./base/CCScheduler.cpp:622 (discriminator 3)
Stack frame #01 pc 005621fc  /data/app/com.example.cocos-1/lib/arm/libCocos2dcpp.so (_ZN7cocos2d9Scheduler13unscheduleAllEv+24): Routine cocos2d::Scheduler::unscheduleAll() at /home/kevin/Projects/Sample/com/example/cocos/../cocos2d/cocos/./base/CCScheduler.cpp:584
Stack frame #02 pc 0055ae40  /data/app/com.example.cocos-1/lib/arm/libCocos2dcpp.so (_ZN7cocos2d9SchedulerD2Ev+48): Routine cocos2d::Scheduler::~Scheduler() at /home/kevin/Projects/Sample/com/example/cocos/../cocos2d/cocos/./base/CCScheduler.cpp:266
Stack frame #03 pc 0067ca78  /data/app/com.example.cocos-1/lib/arm/libCocos2dcpp.so (_ZN7cocos2d13ActionManager9addActionEPNS_6ActionEPNS_4NodeEb+6572): Routine cocos2d::ActionManager::addAction(cocos2d::Action*, cocos2d::Node*, bool) at /home/kevin/Projects/Sample/com/example/cocos/../cocos2d/cocos/./2d/CCActionManager.cpp:195
Stack frame #04 pc 004687fc  /data/app/com.example.cocos-1/lib/arm/libCocos2dcpp.so (_ZN7cocos2d4Node9runActionEPNS_6ActionE+224): Routine cocos2d::Node::runAction(cocos2d::Action*) at /home/kevin/Projects/Sample/com/example/cocos/../cocos2d/cocos/./2d/CCNode.cpp:1399
Stack frame #05 pc 003c0e58  /data/app/com.example.cocos-1/lib/arm/libCocos2dcpp.so (_ZN9NDKHelper13handleMessageEP6json_tS1_+404): Routine NDKHelper::handleMessage(json_t*, json_t*) at /home/kevin/Projects/Sample/com/example/cocos/jni/../../NDKHelper/NDKHelper.cpp:164
Stack frame #06 pc 003c10bc  /data/app/com.example.cocos-1/lib/arm/libCocos2dcpp.so (Java_org_cocos2dx_cpp_easyndk_AndroidNDKHelper_CPPNativeCallHandler+372): Routine Java_org_cocos2dx_cpp_easyndk_AndroidNDKHelper_CPPNativeCallHandler at /home/kevin/Projects/Sample/com/example/cocos/jni/../../NDKHelper/NDKHelper.cpp:228
Stack frame #07 pc 00d82fd1  /data/app/com.example.cocos-1/oat/arm/base.odex (offset 0x8ae000) (void org.cocos2dx.cpp.easyndk.AndroidNDKHelper.CPPNativeCallHandler(java.lang.String)+92)
Stack frame #08 pc 00d8363b  /data/app/com.example.cocos-1/oat/arm/base.odex (offset 0x8ae000) (void org.cocos2dx.cpp.easyndk.AndroidNDKHelper.SendMessageWithParameters(java.lang.String, org.json.JSONObject)+326)
Stack frame #09 pc 012b4293  /data/app/com.example.cocos-1/oat/arm/base.odex (offset 0x8ae000) (void com.example.cocos.CocosPresenter.sendData()+926)
Stack frame #10 pc 012b3ec9  /data/app/com.example.cocos-1/oat/arm/base.odex (offset 0x8ae000) (void com.example.cocos.CocosPresenter.access$000(com.example.cocos.CocosPresenter)+76)
Stack frame #11 pc 00c81517  /data/app/com.example.cocos-1/oat/arm/base.odex (offset 0x8ae000) (void com.example.cocos.CocosPresenter$1.run()+114)
Stack frame #12 pc 72fea1d7  /data/dalvik-cache/arm/system@framework@boot.oat (offset 0x1ec9000)

```

I try with different frequency like 1 every seconds and I have the same problem.

I guess the error provide from the autorelease from a node.
Any help for this problem ?

Thanks

data.title: Fix LNK4098 and LNK2001 warnings
data.body:
Fixes these two warnings: This only applies to the project, when first built the same warnings may happen for the external libraries.

```
warning: LNK4098: defaultlib 'MSVCRT' conflicts with use of other libs; use /NODEFAULTLIB:library
warning: LNK4098: defaultlib 'LIBCMT' conflicts with use of other libs; use /NODEFAULTLIB:library
```

**And**

The `version` library is not linked for MSVC compiler and it produces these errors when compiling with MSVC 19.

```
cocos2dInternal.lib(CCApplication-win32.cpp.obj) : error LNK2001: unresolved external symbol _GetFileVersionInfoSizeW@8
cocos2dInternal.lib(CCApplication-win32.cpp.obj) : error LNK2001: unresolved external symbol _GetFileVersionInfoW@16
cocos2dInternal.lib(CCApplication-win32.cpp.obj) : error LNK2001: unresolved external symbol _VerQueryValueW@16
```

[AUTO][ci skip]: updating cocos2dx_files.json
new JS project with SDKBOX Share is crashing with the the sample application
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: cocos2d-x-3.12 Jul 06 2016
- devices test on: Xcode simulator set as iPhone 6S Plus
- developing environments
  - NDK version: --
  - Xcode version: 7.3.1 El Capitan
  - VS version: --
  - brower type and version: --

Steps to Reproduce:
1. cocos new MyGame -l js -d Path
2. replace app.js with https://github.com/sdkbox/sdkbox-sample-share/blob/master/js/src/app.js
3. sdkbox import facebook
4. sdkbox import share
5. add the following to info.plist

```
    <key>UIRequiresFullScreen</key>
    <true/>
    <key>NSAppTransportSecurity</key>
    <dict>
        <key>NSAllowsArbitraryLoads</key>
        <true/>
    </dict>
    <key>LSApplicationQueriesSchemes</key>
    <array>
        <string>fbapi</string>
        <string>fb-messenger-api</string>
        <string>fbauth2</string>
        <string>fbshareextension</string>
    </array>
    <key>CFBundleURLTypes</key>
    <array>
        <dict>
        <key>CFBundleURLSchemes</key>
        <array>
            <string>fb[your facebook AppId]</string>
        </array>
        </dict>
    </array>
    <key>FacebookAppID</key>
    <string>[your facebook AppId]</string>
    <key>FacebookDisplayName</key>
    <string>Facebook Display Name to change</string>

```
1. Run and do some sharing on Facebook and Twitter, sometimes it takes 20-50 posts to crash:

```
JS: Share
JS: PluginShare onSharestate:6 error:
2016-08-14 21:39:07.626 zzz2-mobile[9970:434206] -canOpenURL: failed for URL: "fbauth2:/" - error: "(null)"
2016-08-14 21:39:07.638 zzz2-mobile[9970:434206] -canOpenURL: failed for URL: "fbauth2:/" - error: "(null)"
JS: PluginShare onSharestate:2 error:
JS: PluginShare onSharestate:2 error:
Assert failed: reference count should be greater than 0
Assertion failed: (_referenceCount > 0), function release, file /Users/jph/Desktop/MyGame/frameworks/cocos2d-x/cocos/base/CCRef.cpp, line 97.

```
1. in app.js, remove the call to sdkbox.PluginShare.setListener(...), then it never crash!

data.title: Default javascript project compile fails for linux platform
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: 3.12
- devices test on: Ubuntu 16.04 (CPU: FX-6300, GPU: GTX-960)

Steps to Reproduce:

```
$ cocos new GameName -p com.game.name -l js
$ cd GameName
$ cocos compile -p linux
```

It compiles up to 100% and on

```
[100%] Linking CXX executable bin/MyGame
```

The it throws a large error (http://pastebin.com/PtLXRjra) being the first and last lines:

First lines:

```
[100%] Linking CXX executable bin/MyGame
lib/libcocos2dInternal.a(CCPhysics3DConstraint.cpp.o): En la funcin `cocos2d::Physics3DPointToPointConstraint::init(cocos2d::Physics3DRigidBody*, cocos2d::Vec3 const&)':
/home/mateo/Escritorio/PatataFreida/frameworks/cocos2d-x/cocos/physics3d/CCPhysics3DConstraint.cpp:113: referencia a `btPoint2PointConstraint::btPoint2PointConstraint(btRigidBody&, btVector3 const&)' sin definir
```

Last lines:

```
/home/mateo/Escritorio/PatataFreida/frameworks/cocos2d-x/cocos/renderer/CCMeshCommand.cpp:180: referencia a `XXH32' sin definir
lib/libcocos2dInternal.a(CCTrianglesCommand.cpp.o): En la funcin `cocos2d::TrianglesCommand::generateMaterialID()':
/home/mateo/Escritorio/PatataFreida/frameworks/cocos2d-x/cocos/renderer/CCTrianglesCommand.cpp:94: referencia a `XXH32' sin definir
collect2: error: ld returned 1 exit status
CMakeFiles/MyGame.dir/build.make:143: fallo en las instrucciones para el objetivo 'bin/MyGame'
make[2]: *** [bin/MyGame] Error 1
CMakeFiles/Makefile2:75: fallo en las instrucciones para el objetivo 'CMakeFiles/MyGame.dir/all'
make[1]: *** [CMakeFiles/MyGame.dir/all] Error 2
Makefile:83: fallo en las instrucciones para el objetivo 'all'
make: *** [all] Error 2
Error running command, return code: 2.
```
#### Complete output: http://pastebin.com/PtLXRjra

It seems to be happening for javascript projects because for cpp projects it compiles succesfully.

data.title: ListView::addEventListener - VS2015 error C2668 ambiguous call to overloaded function
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: 3.12
- devices test on: Lenovo T410s
- developing environments
  - VS version: Visual Studio Community 2015

If one has the following block in the code in a win32 project:

```
#include <ui/CocosGUI.h>
USING_NS_CC;
using namespace cocos2d::ui;
...
...
ListView* listView = ListView::create();
...
listView->addEventListener(CC_CALLBACK_2(MyClass::MyMemberFunction, this));
```

Compiling this will yield the following error with Visual Studio 2015:

```
error C2668: 'cocos2d::ui::ScrollView::addEventListener': ambiguous call to overloaded function
2>  <PROJECT_ROOT>\cocos2d\cocos\ui/UIScrollView.h(346): note: could be
'void cocos2d::ui::ScrollView::addEventListener(const cocos2d::ui::ScrollView::ccScrollViewCallback &)'
2> <PROJECT_ROOT>\cocos2d\cocos\ui/UIListView.h(365): note: or
'void cocos2d::ui::ListView::addEventListener(const cocos2d::ui::ListView::ccListViewCallback &)'
```

According to (MSDN documentation)[https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/da60x087.aspx] on this error, a C-like casting to cocos2d::ui::ListView::ccListViewCallback should do the trick -- which it did. Changing the last line of the first code block to this:

```
listView->addEventListener((ListView::ccListViewCallback)CC_CALLBACK_2(MyClass::MyMemberFunction, this));
```

will allow a successful build, but it would be great if we could eliminate that casting in the addEventListener. I'll try to take a look at this later on, but I won't be able anytime soon.

Note: I've also tested this on Linux and Android builds, but this issue only shows up using VS 2015. Please see the attached files for a full example:

[HelloWorldScene_CPP.txt](https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x/files/416847/HelloWorldScene_CPP.txt)
[HelloWorldScene_H.txt](https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x/files/416848/HelloWorldScene_H.txt)

data.title: [ci skip][AUTO]: updating luabinding & jsbinding automatically
Use the VS 2015 libraries for MSVC 14
data.body: When compiling with MSVC 14, the linker cannot find `libpng-2015.lib`, `libtiff-2015.lib`, `libjpeg-2015.lib` and `libglfw-2015.lib`. This commit fixes that problem. I haven't contributed to the CMake files in cocos2dx before so I'm not really sure If this is in the right format or, really, the best way to do it but it works.

data.title: fix: not resize textureatlas multiple times on Label::create()
data.body:
since we know the size before allocating it, just reserve
the needed capacity once.

fixes github issue #16293

data.title: [lua-tests] Reverts uniform after GetUniformTest.
SimpleAudioEngine does not unpause game music after other music is paused
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: latest v3 (d41124a5b1fc4fe42c421a5d9e92f9d122c0330b)
- devices test on: iPhone6 (iOS 9.3.2)
- developing environments
  - Xcode version: 7.3.1

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Bring up the Control Center, play Wannabe by Spice Girls
2. Run game that has music
3. Notice game music doesn't play (good)
4. Reopen Control Center
5. Pause Spice Girls
6. Close Control Center, game music doesn't start playing

This is using the `SimpleAudioEngine`. I have set this on and do no manual pausing/unpausing of music in the app `application:didFinishLaunchingWithOptions:`

``` objc
[[CDAudioManager sharedManager] setResignBehavior:kAMRBStopPlay autoHandle:YES];
[[CDAudioManager sharedManager] setMode:kAMM_FxPlusMusicIfNoOtherAudio];
```

If you launch the game _without_ external music, then play external music from the control center, the game music stops, and when you pause the external music the game music resumes (as desired).

So it seems like launching with external music playing puts it into a special mode which is not desired in our use case.

data.title: Replace fmod on Linux with SDL Audio or something similar
data.body:
Users have stated that we are not truly open-source on Linux because we require `fmod`. This isn't free and they have no other options. During our weekly meeting @ricardoquesada suggested that we could offer SDL Audio as an alternative and let users turn on `fmod` if they choose to. @linshun agreed. The timing of this change is TBD.

@slackmoehrle is happy to test when ready.

data.title: Replace image of the frameworks architecture in the README
data.body:
The big image in the README has these ugly JPEG artifacts.

I would really like to see it replaced by a losslessly compressed version, as PNG for example.

data.title: Initializes member variable for TMXMapInfo and updates hexa-test.tmx to the latest tmx format.
Android arm64-v8a also uses Luajit.
fixes compile error for win32
data.body:
Visual Studio doesn't like Chinese string in source code.
We should use binary format of Chinese string instead.

UnitTest have been updated some days ago and all Pull Requests passed Jenkins CI, therefore, I have no idea about why `Building UnitTest.cpp` failed on Win32.

Probably, it's because Jenkins CI uses command line to build the project while I used `Visual Studio 2013/2015` editor.

data.title: fixed #16045: WebSocket couldn't receive large data while enabling permessage-deflate.
Started getting strange error on upgrade to cocos2d-x 3.10 from 3.8
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: 3.10
- devices test on: iPad
- developing environments
  - NDK version:
  - Xcode version: 7.3.1
  - VS version:
  - brower type and version:

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Upgrade project created from cocos2d-x 3.8 to cocos2d-x 3.10
2. Started getting strange warning on compile and crash on cocos2d::CSLoader::createNode

Following for warnings
1)  Direct access in cocos2d::CSLoader::createNodeWithFlatBuffersFile(std::__1::basic_string<char, std::__1::char_traits<char>, std::__1::allocator<char> > const&, std::__1::function<void (cocos2d::Ref*)> const&) to global weak symbol typeinfo for cocostudio::WidgetCallBackHandlerProtocol means the weak symbol cannot be overridden at runtime. This was likely caused by different translation units being compiled with different visibility settings.

2)  Direct access in cocos2d::CSLoader::createNode(cocos2d::Data, std::__1::function<void (cocos2d::Ref*)> const&) to global weak symbol typeinfo for cocostudio::WidgetCallBackHandlerProtocol means the weak symbol cannot be overridden at runtime. This was likely caused by different translation units being compiled with different visibility settings.

3) Direct access in cocos2d::CSLoader::nodeWithFlatBuffers(flatbuffers::NodeTree const_, std::__1::function<void (cocos2d::Ref_)> const&) to global weak symbol typeinfo for cocostudio::WidgetCallBackHandlerProtocol means the weak symbol cannot be overridden at runtime. This was likely caused by different translation units being compiled with different visibility settings.

4) Direct access in cocos2d::CSLoader::bindCallback(std::__1::basic_string<char, std::__1::char_traits<char>, std::__1::allocator<char> > const&, std::__1::basic_string<char, std::__1::char_traits<char>, std::__1::allocator<char> > const&, cocos2d::ui::Widget_, cocos2d::Node_) to global weak symbol typeinfo for cocostudio::WidgetCallBackHandlerProtocol means the weak symbol cannot be overridden at runtime. This was likely caused by different translation units being compiled with different visibility settings.

Crash comes after repeatedly using createNode(FIlePath)
